direction.raw_text: : WAGNER'S "GOTTERDAMMERUNG" (Twilight of the Gods)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE TENTH CENTURY A.D.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Viking explorer LEIF ERICSON carefully studies his fob compass as he dangles it above a parchment map. His SAILORS steal nervous looks at a large, diabolical-looking IRON BOX in the hold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a fierce, one-eyed Viking warrior approaches Ericson. NOTE: Dialog is in OLD NORSE, with SUBTITLES)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leif, let's do the deed before another night falls. The crew's near mutiny. Ericson draws his broadsword with a flourish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Know this! The first man to turn will taste my steel in his guts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we've surely gone far enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That accursed box must be thrown off the edge of the world. We will go until we can go no more... Suddenly there is an ear-splitting SCREECH and the entire boat rocks violently as it runs aground. The LOOKOUT is thrown from his crow's nest... and CRASHES straight through the deck right in front of Ericson. His pained voice floats up from the black hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Land ho. Ericson wheels about just as the fog parts off the starboard bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A beautiful rustic coastline stretching off as far as the eye can see.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By Odin's beard...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Olaf finishes digging a hole in the sand. He backs away, terrified, as burly Vikings, led by Ericson, muscle the IRON BOX over to the hole and quickly bury it. Ericson turns to an exotic-looking Eurasian WITCH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quick, Witch. Let the deed be done. The Witch unravels a scroll and recites:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Loki, ancient one. Thy mischief dwell now in waters, base and bland. And in waves and sand thy magic forever sleep... As the Witch speaks, a strong wind kicks up and a black wall of clouds appears. The sky explodes in THUNDER and LIGHTNING. The MEN look about fearfully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Back to the ship men, hurry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Captain, you've discovered a new world. It is your right to name it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave that to the Italians. We're never coming back here. Never. This land is now cursed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 'BEACH CLOSED - RAW SEWAGE - NO SWIMMING' EXT. BEACH - PRESENT DAY Hot, smoggy and packed. Cityscape of towering skyscrapers stands in the haze just beyond the crowded beach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : EDGE CITY - THE PRESENT A caffeine-driven D.J's voice booms over the beach-goers' radios. D.J. (V.O.) Yessiree, it's a four-alarm sizzler out there today with highs in the upper nineties and no relief in sight. We have a third stage smog advisory and a metro traffic gridlock alert. Flourocarbons are up, the Dow Jones is down and we're expecting another Spike Lee movie any second. In other words folks, it's just another bee-youtiful day in Edge City. Camera ENDFRAMES on an industrial barge marked "Department of Sanitation." A crane's cable line disappears underwater.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UNDERWATER - SAME TIME SCUBA WELDERS repair a cracked, scum spewing pipe. One diver hits something hard with his dredger. He unearths...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rust and barnacles partially obscure the engraved images of Norse gods and demons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: wedges his scuba knife under the corroded lock. Erie 'MASK' theme SFX rise as he tries to pry open the lid. Suddenly the PIPELINE BREAKS FREE, crushing the diver and cracking open the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (seen only in rippling shadow) explodes out of the box on a cloud of bubbles and shoots toward the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mask surfaces in the f.g. as lightening EXPLODES across the distant cityscape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A banner displays their proud motto: "WE BANK ON TOMORROW."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (30's) gazes out the window from his cluttered desk as the crack of THUNDER echos through the urban canyons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at those clouds rollin' in, man. Freaky weather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a bright0eyed amiable young account exec pauses by Charlie's desk and drops off a print-out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Charlie, can you go over these stats? We're supposed to have a complete report before lunch. Charlie takes one looks at the complex print-outs and tosses them back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah. Sorry Stanley, I just had my weave tightened and my head is killing me. Be a pal and take those over to Hinkleman, will ya?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a cute young blonde now strolls by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi guys. Did you have any luck with those concert tickets Stanley? Stanley perks up at the sight of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I sure did. Friday night, just like you wanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Stanley, that's wonderful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What time should I pick you up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gee, I don't know. My best girlfriend just got into town and I know she'd love to go. Can we get an extra ticket for her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... uh, actually it's sold out. I was kinda lucky to get these.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's only going to be in town a couple of days and I just can't let her sit at home all alone. Are you sure there isn't something we can do? Stanley considers the situation for a moment, then pulls the tickets out of his pocket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what? Here. You two go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Stanley, I couldn't do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No really. Go ahead. It's okay. I hate concerts anyway. All that, you know... music floating around. Maggie snatches the tickets from Stanley's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is so sweet. Sheila's just going to love this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So maybe you and I can get together over the weekend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure what's going on, but just give me a call. You know I like to be spontaneous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, sure. Me too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley Ipkiss, you are the nicest guy. Maggie gives him a quick air-kiss and hurries off to her teller's window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The kiss of death. As soon as they use the "N" word it's all over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So maybe I am a nice guy. So what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a rug. I am talking astro-turf here. You're letting these women sharpen their cleats on you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'm a gentleman. If they can't appreciate that, it's their problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You spend too much time being "nice" to a girl, you'll wind up sittin' around listening to her complain about the son of a bitch she really loves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, you are a very sick puppy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wake up, Stanley! These are the nineties. We're dealing with an entire generation of dysfunctional love junkies. You can't romance 'em. You gotta confuse 'em. It's the only thing that gets their attention. (PAUSES) Let me demonstrate. You see that girl over there? Stanley looks over at the coffee service where an attractive young WOMAN is pouring herself a cup of coffee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Hi Lisa.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (forgets his name) Oh, hi...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa, this may seem a little odd, but my friend over there and I were having this discusion and I thought maybe you could settle it for us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll help out if I can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, I don't know... this is kind of a personal question.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's okay. Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Just for the sake of argument, if I wasn't a happily married man... am I the kind of guy you'd go out with?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, um... I don't know. (PAUSES) Well... yeah. I guess I would.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lisa, I have terrific news for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not married! Is this perfect or what? Listen, there's not a lot of women willing to come right out like that and admit they're attracted to a guy, but... Lisa SLAPS Charlie, turns on her heel, and marches off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Jeez... make up your mind. Stanley gives Charlie the fish eye as he returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. Bad example. Some of these women got so much baggage they need an emotional sky cap. I'll tell you what Stanley, tonight I'm gonna take you on a love safari, deep into the darkest heart of the urban jungle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And where's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Monkey's Paw. Hottest new club in town. It's a guaranteed skirt alert and no dead beats allowed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So how are we gonna get in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Woah, do I detect a little self-image problem there, buddy? You just leave everything to me. This, my friend is going to be the perfect night on the town. Suddenly a resounding peal of THUNDER rings out like the crack of doom. Sheets of rain pour down on the bank's windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pedestrians scramble for cover in the sudden downpour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A young woman scurries into the bank holding a newspaper over her head. She's soaking wet and pauses in the foyer to straighten herself out. Charlie immediately notices her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold the phone. Killer at three o'clock. Stanley follows his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CAMERA does a classic CHEESECAKE TILT-UP starting with the woman's million dollar legs as she squeezes some of the water out of her skirt... up past her body, which through her damp summer clothes is undeniable proof that there is a God... up... up... to her face as that newspaper is tossed aside. She's a heart-stopping woman/child with a Cupid's bow mouth and ice blue eyes. In other words she's trouble. Big trouble, also known as TINA CARLYLE. Charlie may as well have just seen the Virgin of Guadalupe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (hushed reverence) Oh my god... A perfect dime. The dame of dames. The Moby of my dick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy Charlie. You'll sprain your eyes. Tina now enters and walks towards Stanley and Charlie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, where can I open a new account? Charlie flashes his best 100 watt smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've come to the right place, ma'am. Just step right this way and pull up a chair... Charlie tries to steer Tina to his desk, but she's still preoccupied with her damp clothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I'm sorry. I'm a complete wreck. Will you hold this please? She hands her shoulder bag to Stanley and peels off her wet blazer, creating another awe-inspiring visual moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, let me take that for you. Charlie clutches her jacket with white knuckles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. But Tina turns and sits at Stanley's desk; Charlie is stunned at his near miss, but there's not a thing he can do about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, uh, what kind of account did you have in mind?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles sweetly) Well, I'm not sure exactly. I'm just terrible with things like that. That's an interesting tie Mr...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ipkiss. Stanley Ipkiss... Tina extends her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tina Carlyle. Pleased to meet you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The, uh... pleasure's all mine. Tina notices a box of Kleenex on Stanley's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I? I'm such a mess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... of course. Tina takes out a compact and daintily blots the moisture from her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As I was saying about that tie. It's like one of those, what do you call them, ink blot tests.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rorschach test. She twists open a tube of lip gloss andbegins to run it across her incredibly lush liips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it. It looks like... um. A young woman riding bareback. You know, like a Lady Godiva or something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? I don't think I can... She slowly runs a finger along Stanley's tie.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or... if that's not a horse it could be two lovers. A man and a woman. That would be the woman on top, of course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Of course. She licks her lips and blots them on the Kleenex, leaving a perfect kiss impression and drops it on Stanley's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you see, Mr. Ipkiss? Stanley starts to get uncomfortable under her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. ...Bold colors. It's a power tie, y'know? They're supposed to make you feel... powerful.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Does it work?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sort of. It's just a tie. Now, about that account.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: -UP as Tina drops her compact back in her shoulder bag and we see her flick a red L.E.D. light on. She carefully adjusts the bag, aiming a tiny CAMERA LENS neatly concealed within it. Tina's pointing the bag at the open bank vault that stands a short distance from Stanley's desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : C.U. - VIDEO MONITOR displaying the shot of the vault that Tina is broadcasting.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: INT.
location: MONKEY'S PAW NIGHT CLUB DORIAN TYREL

direction.raw_text: R - INT. MONKEY'S PAW NIGHT CLUB DORIAN TYREL - a slick nouveau-mobster complete with diamond ear stud and Matsuda jacket watches the video broadcast from his INNER sanctum; an eclectic post-modern playroom with an array of electronic toys and minimalist gun racks. Dorian sips nervously on a Yoo-Hoo as he watches the show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's it sweetheart. A little to the right. His two gunsels, SWEET EDDY and CHUN WOO are busy at the back of the room playing air-hockey. Serious firepower is visible in THEIR shoulder holsters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Hey, will you guys keep it down back there? Dorian's safe cracking expert, a black hip-hop artist named DOCTOR FREEZE scribbles notes as he watches the screen with a practiced eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE That's cool, man. Freeze it right there. Dorian punches a button and the image freezes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think, Doctor?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Layout's not bad. We got us a sweet little Perkins/Jenning time lock. But them motion detectors are putting the chill on my thrill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you pull it off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Hey, you're talkin' with the Doctah, man. It's all about time and money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well the meter's runnin' on this one. We got less than a week.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Not cool. What about the coin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's plenty. And I'll be happy to invest your share.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE What you talkin' about, man?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This isn't about the lousy couple hundred thou' that's sitting in that vault, Freeze. That's chump change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Yeah? Then I'm chump number one, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We gotta expand your horizons Doctor. Take a look. Dorian pulls back a curtain. An amazingly gaudy building stands on a pier across the river from Dorian's club. A huge sign across it's archway reads: "Opening Soon Valhalla Casino".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) The Valhalla Casino. Twenty mil of glass, neon, booze and dice. World class sucker bait. The grand opening is Saturday night and it will drive this two bit club of mine out of existence. But I say if you can't beat 'em, take 'em over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Yeah? That's Arnie the Swede's place, man and he is one ice cold meatball eatin' motha fucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave him to me. You pull off this heist and I promise you, it'll be all tits and champagne from here on in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mask lies tangled in a rat's nest of seaweed and garbage that's washed up in a culvert under a bridge. A large WHARF RAT now creeps out along the garbage sniffing curiously at its timeworn wooden surface. It takes a tentative nibble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - THE MASK begins to SHIMMER... to vibrate with its own magical inner life. The rat SQUEAKS and jumps back, disturbing the pile of garbage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R The Mask is dislodged and floats back out into the river. Camera TILTS UP with the Mask as it follows the current into the dark heart of the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley and Charlie are riding along at breakneck speed in a taxi cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold it up right here, please. A gun port suddenly SLAMS open and the wild-eyed Albanian TAXI DRIVER wheels about and cocks a huge .45 from his side of the BULLET riddled partition as the cab continues to barrel through traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hold up?! No hold up! I keel you very well! I splatter your guts big time, Mr. Cowboy Man! Stanley dives for cover.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! No! He only wants you to stop the cab! The driver instantly SLAMS on the brakes, throwing his passengers forward mercilessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (now totally calm) Hokay. Pardon you very much. Charlie helps Stanley sit back up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's alright, Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hate this town. I really hate this town.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you getting out here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta pick up my car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine. Now don't forget. Ten o'clock at the Monkey's Paw. I've already got us lined up with a couple of authentic dimes. Stanley steps out of the cab.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, please. The last time you said that you showed up with two lesbian mud-wrestlers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I can't promise we'll get that lucky again... Later! With a SCREAM of tires the cab peels back out into traffic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley enters the grease spattered, cluttered garage and scans the area for signs of life. We can hear the CLANK-CLANK-CRASH of SOME less than light-fingered automotive work in progress. Stanley DINGS a little service bell sitting on a counter plastered with naked playmate decoupage and Mrs. Power Tool '93 calendars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Hello?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a lumbering unshaven behemoth of a man with permanently low- slung refrigerator repairman pants, makes his way past half rebuilt car carcasses towards Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hang on. Hong on. Don't get your panties in a twist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: a thinner version of Irv with Coke bottle glasses and a mop of greasy hair, pops up from beneath a car, RIPS out of chunk of motor and wiring and holds it up to Irv.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (examining part) Hey Irv, what the hell is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (eyes it carefully) Ohh... I dunno. About seven hundred bucks. They both laugh evilly as Irv slaps Burt on the back. Irv makes his way over to Stanley, still chuckling to himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now what can I do for you, Bub?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm here for the Civic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Japanese car, right? Kind of a nasty pea soup green?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, they call it Emeral Forest, actually... Irv turns back to Burt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt! Pea green Civic! Burt pops back up from beneath the hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Green Civic... Green Civic. Oh yeah! Brake drums are still on order and I'm only halfway through rebuilding the trans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I just brought it in for an oil change!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? Well you're lucky we caught those other problems before they caused some serious trouble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Alright. When will it be ready? Irv looks over at Burt, who gives him a "Make something up" look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come back tomorro... (Burt shakes his head "no".) ...First thing next wee... (Burt shakes again) ...next month? (Burt shakes an enthusiastic "yes".) Yeah, first thing next month. That's if we can get the parts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What am I going to do in the meantime? I can't afford to keep taking cabs all over town. Irv smiles a rotten-toothed smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hell... we can take care of that! (to Burt archly) Hey Burt, bring around the loaner. (to Stanley) And for you little buddy, only ten bucks a day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The joint is jumping with musclehead BOUNCERS picking and choosing from the crowd of terminally trendy WANNABE'S gathered around the entrance. A light drizzle is falling. A parade of swanky cars pulls up one by one as CAR HOPS scurry to keep up with the flow; A glistening pearlescent Rolls Royce. A fire engine red Ferrari. A classic two tone Corniche in tan and burgundy. And finally a broken down Citroen in rust bucket red and spackle gray RUMBLES up to the front of the club with a disgruntled Stanley behind the wheel. A car hop attempts to open the door, but it's rusted shut. Stanley throws his shoulder into it and the door finally pops open with a SCREECH of metal. Stanley nearly tumbles out into the street. He smiles nervously at a high class couple looking with disdain at the eyesore-mobile. He pats the hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a classic. The car hop jumps in and tries to throw the car into gear with a horrible GRINDING. He finally waves over two other car hops who quickly push it off down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, Stanley. Nice wheels. What is that, a Rolls Canardley?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, a Rolls Canardley. Rolls down one hill canardley roll up the next. (he cracks up)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are not discussing the car, okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whatever you say, man. Charlie gestures expansively towards the club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think? Pretty terrific, huh? This place make Sodom and Gomorrah look like Mayberry. Stanley now notices a life-sized poster of Tina Carlyle standing by the main entrance that reads "Featuring the Musical Stylings of Miss Tina Carlyle."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, isn't that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. The wet dream from the bank. (PAUSES) Hold on... I think I see my future ex-wife. Two rather tacky looking GIRLS beckon Charlie from the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Charlie! Charlie!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're in luck. It's Barbie and Pebbles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Doesn't it bother you that all the women you know are named after cartoon characters? Barbie and Pebbles hurry over through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been waiting out here for hours. Can you get us in?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, problemo. Ladies, this is my pal Stanley Ipkiss. (leans closer) Stanley's very influential in the banking business. Charlie is truly in his element as he elbows his way through the crowd dragging his entourage with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie finally makes through the crush of badies at the entry way's velvet ropes and calls to one of the two hulking BOUNCERS that guard the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Bobby! Bobby, buddy. What's happening man? Bobby completely ignores Charlie as he ushers a pasty faced ROCK STAR and his underage TARTLET past the ropes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (to the girls) This will just take a second. (to the other bouncer) Yo Nick! It's me... Charlie! Nick is also completely oblivious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it, Charlie. I refuse to stand here waiting to be judged by these power-mad steroid jockeys.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How much cash you got on you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard me. How much you got?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I dunno, fifty or sixty bucks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hand it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, I'll pay you back! I'm only carrying plastic. C'mon man, you want to stand out here all night? Stanley begrudgingly starts to count out some cash. Charlie snatches the whole wad and elbows his way back around to the ropes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (subtly flashing bills) Hey Bobby! Bobby's uncanny tip radar suddenly lights up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charlie, how you doin' man? Long time no see. Bobby unsnaps the rope for Charlie and gets the cash handshake he longs for. The crowd surges around Charlie, Barbie and Pebbles as they step by, briefly cutting Stanley off. He catches up just as the all-important rope is SNAPPED closed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, wait a minute! Charlie! But Charlie and the girls have already been whisked inside. Dorian now steps out of the club and begins to check Bobby's list.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I'm with them! Hey, Bobby! But Bobby is back into his deaf and dumb routine. Stanley unsnaps the rope himself and starts throgh. Bobby and BOUNCER #2 IMMEDIATELY grab Stanley and quickly subdue him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! Leggo... awk! Dorian glares at Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lose him. The bouncers drag Stanley through the crowd and unceremoniously toss him out into the rain-slick street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley slowly rises, smoothing out his disheveled clothing. A horn BLARES and Stanley scrambles to one side as a limo swings into the club's alleyway, splattering him with a wave of muddy water. Stanley wipes the mud from his eyes just in time to see Tina Carlyle escorted from the back of the limo by a CHAUFFEUR carrying an umbrella. She's shoe-horned into a heart-stopping red dress that's fighting a losing battle to restrain her decolletage. Their EYES MEET. Tina pauses as she recognizes him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... Stanley. Hi. Stanley realizes he looks ridiculous but gives a pathetic little wave hello anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Are you okay? Stanley gestures "no problem" and tries to strike a casual pose against a street lamp, but slips and nearly falls. With a SQUEAL of grinding gears and the KA-POW of a backfire, the car hop pulls Stanley's battered loaner right up behind him. Stanley flashes a last nervous smile at Tina, and digs for the car hop's tip money... nothing. He shrugs apologetically to the disgusted car hop and climbs in. The car RATTLES, COUGHS the finally ROARS off in a cloud of NOXIOUS exhaust fumes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A forlorn looking spot on the outskirts of Edge City. We can hear Stanley's car SPUTTERING and POPPING along before it actually pulls into sight on the dark rain-slick street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley drives along in a miserable daze. Suddenly the engine starts KNOCKING violently and the car dies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Steam HISSES from the radiator as the car slowly rolls to a stop. Stanley GRINDS the ignition key again and again trying futilely to restart the engine. Finally, Stanley fights his way out of the rusted door with a SQUEAL of metal, turns and kicks the bumper... which promptly falls off with a resounding CLUNK. Beat. The front axle collapses, the tires fall off and the driver's side door CLATTERS to the ground. Stanley stands there staring at the steaming heap of useless metal... his mind a complete blank. He slowly turns, looking down at the black brackish water swirling along beneath the Tahoochie Bridge. A wave of melancholy sweeps over him. Stanley plucks a button from his coat and watches as it drops down... down to the river below. Suddenly, something catches Stanley's eye... a BODY, floating along in the darkness. He snaps back to reality.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Hey... Hey mister!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley rushes down the slippery embankment beneath the bridge. He spots the body dead ahead, floating along in the moonlight and HURRIES as fast as he can.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with Stanley as he scrambles down the slope; a black cat YOWLS as it races past him. He steps on and shatters a discarded mirror, and he ducks under an old ladder that leans against the bridge's foundation as he finally reaches the shore. Stanley splashes into the waist deep water just in time to catch the body as it floats by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R - BODY As Stanley grabs it, the "body" falls to pieces... revealing that it's nothing but a trash bag, an old tire and some floating bits of garbage all clinging to the "head": an old wooden Mask. Stanley shakes his head in disgust... some lifesaver. Stanley inspects the Mask more closely; strange ritualistic symbols carved into a puckish face with a leering grin and eerie empty eye holes. The faintest sound of a haunting "Mask SFX Theme" rises as Stanley turns the Mask around and inspects the inside... slowly bringing it closer and closer to his face. The surface of the Mask begins to SHIMMER. But then... RIBET! A frog jumps out of it, right into Stanley's face. Stanley nearly loses his footing on the slippery river bottom. Suddenly a blinding SPOTLIGHT shines down from the bridge and an amplified voice calls out from a squad car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, you! What are you doing down there? Stanley squints into the light, trying to think of a reasonable answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was just looking for... (holds up Mask) My mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The club is closing up. WAITERS stack chairs on top of tables in the B.G. as Tina gathers her sheet music from her PIANIST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks Reno, you're the greatest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: G'night, doll. Tina crosses to the bar area where Dorian lounges with DR. FREEZE, SWEET EDDY and CHUN WOO. Dorian toasts her as she pulls up a bar stool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was a great performance, baby. But not as great as the one you pulled off at the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, well don't get used to it. I'm not going to start running cons for you again, Dorian. I'm a singer now and that's it. Dorian rolls his eyes at Freeze, "Get her".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really? And you had such a red hot career before you latched on to me? Tina pours herself a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who latched on to who?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get real, Tina. You'll do what I say or I'll drop you back where I found you, slingin' hash and dodgin' horny peterbuilt drivers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (downs a shot) Don't push me, Nicky. I might just take a walk I should have taken a long time ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy, baby. Easy. (to his men) I love it when she gets pissed. Dorian scoots over and puts an arm around Tina. She remains cool.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) C'mere. You take a hike and who's gonna kiss you like Dorian Tyrel. Tina pours another shot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) C'mon. Who? Tina finally cracks a smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulls her close) That's right, baby. C'mere. Tina slowly leans in for a kiss, her lips softly parted... but raises a finger to Dorian's lips, stopping him cold. She glances over at Freeze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. I never get personal in front of the help. Tina abruptly stands and exits as Freeze glares at her. Dorian breaks into laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That broad kills me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE She just might, man. The bitch is trouble. Dorian pours them all a drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon Doctor, lighten up. (raises his glass) Here's to Edge City Bank. May it crack like an egg on Easter Sunday. Their glasses CLINK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The police car pulls up in front of Stanley's brownstone and he wearily climbs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, Mr. Ipkiss. Try to be a little more careful next time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks Officer. The black and white pulls away and Stanley starts across the empty street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, mister... Stanley turns. A razor-cut DEATH'S HEAD PUNKER hops down from a fire escape in a darkened alleyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You a cop or something? A half dozen other DEATH'S HEADS appear out of the shadows all decked out in nipple chains, tattoos and other self-mutilation-
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: oddments.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... no. They just gave me a lift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A cop chauffeur? I never seen that before. How about you boys? The other Death's Heads pipe up with "Not Me," "Nope," "Pretty special," etc. as they slowly surround Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright, you guys. It's been a tough night. I haven't got any money. I haven't got a car. All I have is this and you're welcome to it. Stanley tosses Death's Head #1 the Mask. He briefly inspects the funky looking antique, still slick with river slime, then tosses it back. He approaches Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, man. You got us all wrong. We don't want any trouble. I was just going to ask you for the time. That's all. You got the time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh... yeah. As Stanley pulls back his sleeve to check his watch, the Death's Head flicks out a butterfly knife. With a FLASH of steel, he slices straight through Stanley's watch band and snatches the watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (holding up his prize) See, I only wanted the time! Heh, he, heh... All the punkers laugh like the half-wits they are as Death's Head #1 shoves Stanley into Death's Head #2. #2 pushes him back across to #3 and so on. Stanley is roughly bounced back and forth more and more violently within the circle of giggling street toughs. He finally breaks free and scrambles to his front door, still reeling with dizziness. He fumbles with the key and SLAMS the door behind him as the Death's Heads roar with laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley's wet shoes SQUEAK as he tiptoes past -
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - MANAGER A sign that reads "Quiet Please" hangs from the doorknob. Stanley continues past it to Apartment "B". Just as he removes his keys - THE Manager's door flies open and MRS. PEENMAN appears. She's an old dragon in hair curlers who will probably live forever just to spite her relatives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PEENMAN Ipkiss! Do you have any idea what time it is? Reflexively, he looks at his (now empty) wrist.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, no.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PEENMAN It's three o'clock in the morning! First, you wake up the entire building laughing it up with your pals. Then, you come in and start squeak - (sees puddles) My new carpet! Just look at that! This is coming out of your cleaning deposit Ipkiss! Stanley, battered, bruised and soaking wet is deep in urban shell-shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you done?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PEENMAN ...Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'll be going to bed now. Mrs. Peenman SLAMS her door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Small, full of books but very neat. A few cherished animation cels from 1940s cartoons are framed on the wall. As Stanley locks the door behind him - he's greeted by MILO, a happy little terrie sized mutt with a big heart.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Milo. Milo gets so excited he starts GAGGING and COUGHING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Easy, buddy. I missed you too. Stanley pats Milo on the rump, crosses his tiny kitchenette and heads straight into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley's prized collection of "golden Age" Looney Tunes tapes are neatly displayed on a simple bookshelf. He tosses the Mask down on his bedside table, pops one of his cherished Tex Avery cartoons into the V.C.R., plops down on his bed and starts to strip off his shoes and socks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: enters, holding a Frisbee in his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) C'mon, Milo. I'm beat. (to the dog YIPS) Okay, okay. One throw. Stanley tosses the Frisbee into the air. The disk sails...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo runs it down, leaps up, and makes a perfect catch. He trots back to the bedroom, and drops it in Stanley's lap.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OUT OF THE BEDROOM AND INTO THE HALLWAY

direction.raw_text: Easy. This is the best part. On the screen a cartoon dog ZZZIPS into frame and drops a frizzing stick of dynamite down a bad guy's pants. KA-BOOM! The dog LAUGHS maniacally. Suddenly there is a POUNDING on the wall that rattles Stanley's framed cartoon cels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (calls out) Sorry Mrs. Peenman. With a sigh, he ejects the tape and a much quieter talk show POPS on. Larry King and a guest. Stanley rises and crosses into the bathroom to wash up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON T.V. King's guest, Dr. Arthur Neuman, is replying to a caller.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEUMAN That's correct. The truth is we all wear masks, metaphorically speaking. We repress the Id... our darkest desires and hide behind a more socially acceptable image of ourselves in order to cope with the frustrations of our day to day lives. Stanley's only half listening though the open bathroom door as he brushes his teeth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think I'm repressed, Milo? Stanley tries a couple of fierce expressions in the bathroom mirror, his mouth foaming with toothpaste. Milo does that doggie-head-cocked-sideways "What the hell?" look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (HALF-HEARTEDLY) Nah. He spits and rinses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ON T.V. as King wraps it up, displaying the doctor's book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The book is "The Masks We Wear," by Dr. Arthur Neuman. Thank you Dr. Neuman. Stanley pops off the T.V.with his remote.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No thank you, Dr. Neuman. As he buttons up his P.J.s, Stanley notices Milo warily sniffing at the strange Mask, which is still lying on the bedside table. A SUBTLE SHIMMER crosses its surface. Milo WHIMPERS and quickly hops off the bed. We now begin to hear the "Mask Theme"... echoes of the POUNDING Viking drums... growing louder. Haunting whispery VOICES seem to call to Stanley as he slowly crosses to the bedside. He picks up the Mask and turns it over in his hands running his fingers across the time work wood. The music builds... He turns back to the bathroom mirror and slowly raises the Mask to his face. Milo watches apprehensively from beneath the bed. For an instant - the MASK SHRINK WRAPS like a vacuum over Stanley's head. We hear the PIERCING MASK SFX. Then, a beat later, the Mask is off with a POP. The SFX STOP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Whoa. Stanley studies the old mask, then his own face in the mirror. Everything's status quo. It must have been his imagination.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Naw... He puts the Mask on again - firmly this time. Milo dives under the bed as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: shoot out of the Mask and wrap around Stanley's head - locking the Mask in place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: magically reweave themselves... growing in all directions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: turning lime green as it unites with the Mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - His body begins to move uncontrollably. Spinning faster and faster like a gyroscope. The SFX get loonier and loonier as he becomes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Stanley's words are almost unintelligible as his voice jumps one, two, five octaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hellllllllppppmmmmmmmeeeeeeeee...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: reaches out of the twister and locks onto the bedpost. The whirlwind SCREECHES to a halt, causing sparks and smoke to rise FROM the singed carpet. The smoke clears revealing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's dressed in a snazzy zoot suit - a distortion of the paisley material of Stanley's pajamas. The head is no longer Stanley's. It's large, bald and bright green. The huge bug-eyes glow with mischief. The nose is small, bony and beaked. The mouth and teeth are enormous and gleaming white as he breaks into a learning grin. The overall effect is devilishly loony, but not altogether unhuman. In fact, there's something downright charming about him. The Mask checks himself out in the mirror and likes what he sees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S-s-s-nazzy! He SNAPS his bow tie with a crazy gleam in his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) It's party time!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trying to ber VERY, VERY quiet, the Mask tiptoes down the darkened corridor. The floor makes a barely audible CREEEEK as the Mask steps with exaggerated care pst APARTMENT "A" with it's little "Quiet Please" sign. He raises a finger to his lip, making the "SHUSH" sign. Suddenly - and unexplicably - a ringing ALARM CLOCK leaps out of Stanley/Mask's pocket and starts jittering down the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: jeepers--! Stanley/Mask tries to snag the clock, but it bounces away every time. Frustrated, he pulls a full sized SLEDGEHAMMER from his pocket and starts POUNDING the floor in an effort to stop the clock. Glancing blows shatter the clock face and most of the works, but those bells just keep ringing. The hammer, of course, slams craters the size of manhole covers into the floor and reverberates through the building like THUNDERBOLTS. The door bursts open and Mrs. Peenman's angry face pops out covered in blue mud pack and framed in curlers. She gets one look at the Mask with his oversized carnival mallet raised over his head and SCREAMS bloody murder. The Mask SCREAMS in response, his eyes bugging out on stalks and his mouth expanding to the size of a tuba in mock horror. Mrs. Peenman's door SLAMS shut and reopens a beat later as she appears cocking an enormous shotgun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy lady! I was just killin' time! The Mask starts ricocheting off the walls HOOTING maniacal laughter as Mrs. Peenman lets loose with both barrels. KA-BOOM. The Mask bounces off walls as Mrs. Peenman continues to blast away, and finally leaps straight out the window. KEE-RASH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sending his body SAILING our through the air towards the street seven stories below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . CITY STREET - NIGHT SPLAT. Stanley/Mask lands face up in the middle of the street. He slow... painfully starts to rise as a STREET CLEANING machine turns a corner and RUNS DIRECTLY OVER HIM. The machine disappears down the street as we HOLD on Stanley/Mask's flattened body. He raises one arm, grabs himself by the head and peels himself off the street. He shakes himself out with one sharp CRACK and straightens his zoot suit. He's shocked to find a tiny SPOT on his sleeve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey! You missed a spot! As if on cue, a SECOND street cleaning machine SLAMS into him and RUNS OVER HIM AGAIN. This time he reinflates himself back into 3- D by blowing into his thumb and hops up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And next time, no starch! Fully recovered, Stanley/Mask starts down the street, strutting like a prize fighter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey mister... Death's Head punker #1 hops down from his fire esscape behind the Mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 (grins evilly) ...You got the time? The Mask turns to see he is surrounded by the Death's Head punkers. He seems to be delighted by their presence, but now that they see his face, they're totally freaked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (wiggles eyebrows) Why of course, Cubbie. I got all the time in the world! He whips out his forearm (which grows large for emphasis cartoon- style). It's covered with crazily spinning watches, CHIMING cuckoo clocks and sun dials.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: London, Paris, Rome, standard, substandard and no standards at all! And for our English friends we have... Big Ben!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #1 Big Ben? Stanley/Mask KICKS a nearby street post, snapping it in half and sending a large decorative street clock PLUMMETING into the sidewalk. KA-BONG! It completely obliterates Death's Head #1. The other gang members jump back in shock as the Mask races around the corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 Get him! The Death's Heads pull out nasty homemade weapons and race around the corner into the alleyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They come to a screeching halt as they discover Stanley/Mask dressed as a carnival barker. Multicolored lights and Calliope music come from out of nowhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And for my next trick... Long pink and blue balloons appear in Stanley/Mask's hands and he instantly goes into a frenzy of twisting and knotting them into AN elaborate balloon sculpture. SQUEAK. SQUEAK. SCREECH. The Death's Heads are too stunned by the severe weirdness of all this to do anything but stand there and stare. (These guys were no rocket scientists in the first place.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) And viola! We have a giraffe! Sure enough, he's created a first rate balloon sculpture. He hands it to the biggest, dumbest Death's Head, who grins like a little kid upon receiving it. The Mask instantly goes into another flurry of motion, sculpting more balloons. SCREECH POP.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) A few more twists of the wrist and for you, Cubbie. He hands this next prize to Death's Head #3.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) A French poodle! And finally my favorite... He goes into another flurry of motion. E.C.U. - BALLOON As the Mask pulls the ends of the knotted balloon, it straightens out and MORPHS into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) A Tommy gun! A real one! He immediately sprays the Death's Heads with hot lead. RATATATATATAT! The greasy punkers dive for cover and scramble out of the alley under a hail of bullets. Stanley/Mask tosses the gun aside, intoxicated with his newfound powers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Wait a minute. This is incredible! Why, with these powers I could be a superhero! I could fight crime... Work for world peace... C.U. - THE MASK MASK (CONT.) But first!...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's late, but there's still a light on inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Burt and Irv, both woozy from drink, attempt to finish a card game. A dozen empty beer bottles and two half eaten chili dogs adorn the table. Irv takes a big bite of his chili dog and pauses to regard it like a true connoisseur.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now these are serious chili dogs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know. Here's the proof... (lets out a long BUUURP) Aaah. Even tastier the second time around. Irv leans forward and sticks out his index finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey Burt, pull on my finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No way, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, really. Go ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Irv, don't... Irv raises a leg anyway and rips off a nasty fart. BRAAAP!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That, my friend is the sweet smell of success.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No style. I give it a five tops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, how about... Soprano. Irv shifts his weight and hits an amazing high note. PWEEEEEP! Burt is impressed in spite of himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fine muscle control.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And now for my grand finale,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... The audience is listening! Irv lets one loose in perfect sensurround. Suddenly the front door EXPLODES inward. Stanley/Mask stands there SILHOUETTED like a gunfighter from a Clint Eastwood movie. Irv squints into the light, unable to make out the mysterious figure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, 40 watt... we're closed! Nobody's here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah... but you're here. Irv rises.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I mean is... He lets loose a sneaker to help make his point. POOOOT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody's here that wants to help you. Stanley/Mask now steps into the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I'm here to help you. Burt and Irv's eyes go wide as they get a better look at their nemesis. Fear loosens Irv's sphincter and a last feeble bit of gas escapes with a FWEEP! Stanley/Mask whirls about with a flourish and pulls two gleaming mufflers from the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sounds like you have a little exhaust problem there! There's a mad gleam in his eyes as he spins the mufflers like two huge pistols and SNAPS them to a halt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) We better do a few touch ups before you have some serious trouble. The Mask TWIRLS out of frame like a human tornado. Camera PUSHES IN past Burt and Irv's shocked expressions into an E.C.U. of the garage's bare light bulb as it JIGGLES on its wire. We can't see the mayhem, but we can hear wacky/bizarre sound F.X. as the Mask whirls about the garage. WHIZ! SCREECH! BANG! AHOOGA!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No!... Wait! Eeeeeyaah!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : As that light bulb becomes the morning SUN peaking over Edge City's skyline. CAMERA PULLS BACK through Stanley's bedroom window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley slowly awakens. He grabs his head and moans, looking and feeling completely hung over. Then suddenly he remembers - and JUMPS out of bed with a start. He looks in the mirror, touching his face. It's the same old Stanley. He looks at his paisley PJ's. Same old PJ's. He picks up the mask. Same old mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A dream... It was only a dream. Stanley starts to relax. There's a KNOCK at the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley's greeted by LT. KELLAWAY (50). This hound-dog of a cop can't help but stare at Stanley's garish pajamas.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KELLAWAY Nice PJ's pal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can I help you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KELLAWAY You're Ipkiss? Stanley Ipkiss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KELLAWAY Some kind of prowler broke in and attacked Mrs. Peenman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (swallows hard) Really? I didn't hear a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KELLAWAY Then you must be a pretty sound sleeper, Ipkiss 'cause she unloaded a couple rounds of 20 ott buckshot five feet from your door. Kellaway swings Stanley's door open wider to give him a better view of the damage. Mrs. Peenman stands there in the hall tearfully speaking to anither OFFICER. Stanley is flabbergasted to see:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C.U. - The shotgun blasts in the walls. C.U. - The pot holes left from the mallet. C.U. - The shattered remains of the wacky alarm clock. All flashbacks from last night!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's... impossible!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . KELLAWAY Excuse me? Stanley quickly pulls himself together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's... a, possible. See, I have this inner ear problem. (wiggles a finger in his ear vigorously) Sometimes I can't hear a thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that a fact?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? Kellaway leans closer to speak more loudly, but catches himself and shoots Stanley a dirty look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget it. He hands Stanley his card.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Here. You remember anything unusual about last night, anything at all, call me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure... thanks. Stanley SLAMS the door and throws his body against it, his heart pounding in his chest. Milo gives him that curious dog-head-cocked-sideways look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Milo, it was real! How could it all be... real? Stanley suddenly notices the clock on the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Oh my god. I'm late! He races into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kellaway is taking notes as patiently as he can from Mrs. Peenman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Mrs. Peenman, you gotta admit your description is pretty tough to swallow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PEENMAN Then you can choke on it for all I care. I saw what I saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Right. (refers to notes) A green head the size of a pumpkin, purple zoot suit and spats. That's a pretty serious fashion risk for any self-respecting second story man. An OFFICER now hurries up the steps all out of breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lt., we just got an emergency call from a mechanic on 67th Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Some kind of assault and battery. Sound pretty bad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alright. Dont' worry Mrs. Peenman, we'll find this guy for you. Officer Deluca here has a few forms you'll have to fill out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley rushes around the apartment, but he can't find his keys anywhere. He finishes tying his tie as he searches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo! Keys! Keys!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milo's ears prick. He leaps up and immediately starts sniffing around. He pulls a cushion off the sofa and emerges with the keys just as Stanley comes out, briefcaase in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good boy. He pets his dog, takes his keys and starts out the door... but he pauses to take a last look at the mask... It's eerie black eye holes and devilish grin seem to mock him. On sudden impulse, he grabs it, hurls it out the balcony's sliding glass door and exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE MASK Sailing end over end through the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the mask flies out into the sir, a sudden wind kicks up. The mask arcs back toward the building like a boomerang and lands balanced precariously on a narrow ledge. Its mocking grin seems to glow with triumph.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The place looks like it's been hit by cartoon graffiti guerrillas: Everything's printed in polka-dots, checks, tartan, etc. The "Ripley Auto Finishing" sign hangs askew over the doorway. Letters have been sprayed out to read "Rip Off!" Several REPORTERS and curious ONLOOKERS stand nearby as Kellaway and his men take it all in. PARAMEDICS appear wheeling Burt and Irv out of the building on two gurneys. They're both in severe discomfort and look more like cars than men: Bodies spray painted metallic colors, hood ornaments glued to their foreheads, wire rims under each limb, and gleaming four foot long mufflers sticking out of their rear ends. They wince in pain at each tiny bump of the gurney.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah!... Eeeh!... Ooh! Paramedic #3 speaks into his emergency radio-phone as Burt and Irv are loaded into the van.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #3 I want a proctologist standing by! Yeah, you heard me! The best one you can find. An OFFICER steps out of the building and approaches Kellaway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were able to get a description Lt., but it's pretty weird.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me guess... Big green head. Zoot suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How did you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoever this guy is, he's a world class twisto.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: an attractive young woman in her mid twenties, appears besides the other reporters and approaches Kellaway, notepad in hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, Lt., I'm with the Evening Star. Can you tell me what happened here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry. Too early to comment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks like some kind of mob scare tactic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said no comment. Now break it up. This is a crime scene. As the officers disperse the reporters and other onlookers, Peggy slips away from the group. Even though it's closed off with yellow police tape, Peggy slips inside the garage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The empty garage has been turned into a topsy-turvy nightmare. The same cartoon paint job covers the walls. Peggy looks around, SIFTING through some papers scattered all over the floor. Nothing. Then she spies the COMPLAINT BOX. Peggy opens it and pulls out a HANDFUL of pink "comment" slips. She looks at them. Almost all of them are from one customer - STANLEY IPKISS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley, still looking rumpled and unshaven, hurriedly takes off his coat and powers up his computer. Charlie steps over to his desk carrying a newspaper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened to you last night? The girls and I were looking all over for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I uh, didn't feel so good. I decided to go home early.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As a matter of fact, you don't look so good. You got to take better care of yourself, man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How was the club?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you kidding? It was hotter than a pistol. Did you see the paper?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your girlfriend got a great review. Chralie flips open the Entertainment section of the Evening Star. There's a great close-up of Tina singing her heart out with the HEADLINE "Bombshell Explodes at Monnkey's Paw."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DICKEY, the smarmy office manager who is younger than Stanley, now appears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ipkiss! You're forty minutes late! Every time you do that you're robbing this bank of its time and money!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, Mr. Dicky. It won't happen again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snatches newspaper) If you weren't so busy ogling girlie pictures you'd get some work done around here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah... She's a prospective client of Stanley's, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sudden attitude change) She is? Well... Next time she comes in see that you send her directly to my office.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes sir, Mr. Dickey. Dickey tosses the paper back on Stanley's desk and marches off through the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that little creep. If it wasn't for his daddy he'd be out somewhere shakin' down school kids for lunch money. Stanley toys with the Kleenex that bears Tina's lipstick "kiss".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You think she ever will come back, Charlie?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who knows? Forget about her, Stanley. A dame like that is always looking for the B.B.D. The bigger better deal. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't know that. She's an artist. Maybe she's sensitive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. She can sense a guy's credit line at two hundred yards. Stanley, you need a girl you can depend on. Someone a little more down to earth... someone like...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ACROSS THE BANK as Peggy Brandt stops by a teller's window, looking sharp and pretty in a blazer and jeans.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, can you tell me where I can find Stanley Ipkiss?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like her! Someone like her. (straightens tie) As a matter of fact I could use someone like her myself. (rises as Peggy approaches) Hel-lo there. May I be of some assistance?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley Ipkiss? Charlie begrudgingly points to Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Hi. I'm Peggy Brandt. I'm with the Evening Star.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, hi. I already have a subscription, thanks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no, actually I just wanted to ask you a few questions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Really? About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ripley Auto Finishing. You're a customer of theirs aren't you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... uh. No. I think you must have made a mistake. Peggy produces one of the complaint slips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't this a form of theirs you filled out?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nervous chuckle) Oh, that Ripley Auto. I guess I have stopped in there once or twice, Miss... what did you say your name was?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Peggy Brandt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute... Peggy Brandt of "Ask Peggy"?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (brightens up) You printed my letter last year, remember? "Nice Guys Finish Last."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're Mr. Nice Guy? Stanley do you realize how much mail we got about that letter? There's hundreds of women out there who are looking for a man just like you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you serious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. DO you know how hard it is to find a decent man in this town? Most of them think monogamy is some kind of wood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you covering this story?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They cut my salary. I just can't make it by on "Dear Peggy" anymore. The truth is, I want to be a real reporter and if I can break this story I know they'll let me. (sits closer) Look Stanley, I know Ripley Auto is a crooked operation. They may even have had ties to the Mob. I'm not out to get you. I just want the truth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I knew the truth, Peggy. I really do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A well dressed MAN checks from beneath his sunglasses to see nobody's watching and RAPS on the door. It opens and he quickly DISAPPEARS inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweet Eddy escorts him inside. The man removes his glasses and glances about nervously. Dorian sits at his desk. Dr. Freeze and Chun Woo are going over an array of high tech burglary equipment laid out on the air hockey table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good afternoon, Councilman Snell. Nice of you to drop by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cut the crap. Dorian. What's so important that I had to come here in person? Dorian gazes out the window to the Valhalla Casino.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I got a little job for you, Tom. I want you to pull the Swede's gambling license.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's impossible. He was approved six months ago.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull a few strings. Find something in the fine print. I don't care how you do it, but do it. You owe me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I owe you nothing, you little piece of shit. I got your liquor license when nobody else would touch... Dorian suddenly EXPLODES, overturning his desk and sending Snell tumbling backwards. In less than a heartbeat, he grabs Snell by his shirt ffront, SLAMS him up against the wall, SMASHES a whiskey bottle and presses the jagged edge to his throat. Snell hangs there whimpering. Dorian has a crazed look in his eyes as he gazes at the Councilman's lapel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's pretty. What is that, a carnation? Snell nods. Dorian takes a deep whiff.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Nice. Hey, Eddy... call my florist. Two dozen pink carnations to Mrs. Snell with my regrets over her husband's untimely accident. Tears begin to well up in Snell's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... please. I can do it. I can make it happen. Dorian eases back... brushes off Snell's coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's smart. You're a very smart man. Now pull yourself together. Look at you. Dorian picks up an Uzi from Dr. Freeze's equipment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Shut the Swede down, Snell. We'll buy him out cheap with a little collateral the bank is about to provide us. (looks at his men) And Gentlemen... we are going to be in the casino business.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distant sirens can be heard over the occasional sound of a gunshot. It's a reasonably peaceful night in Edge City.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S off of Tina's picture, which is now taped to Stanley's dresser mirror... to Stanley himself as he tosses and turns in a fitful sleep. Milo lies curled up at the foot of the bed. He looks concerned over the little noises Stanley is making in his sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .C.U. of Stanley as we
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - a 1940s noir-style montage: Huge soft-lit faces loom over him, one dissolving into the next... Tina, luminous and breathtaking speaks under heavily lidded eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or it could be two lovers. That would be the woman on top, of course... Charlie looms up out of the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget her, Stanley. Ask her what her sign is and she'll say dollar. Mr. Dickey appears, glaring down angrily at Stanley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every time you're late Ipkiss, you're robbing this bank! The shrink from the "larry King Show" floats by on a cloud of pipe smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . NEUMAN We must repress our Id... our deepest darkest desires. Finally Tina again standing beside the limo as she was that night in the Monkey's Paw alley:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, are you okay. Stanley stands at the curb, but this time he's not splattered with mud. He's decked out in first class Armani and looks suave as hell. He looks straight into her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am now. C'mere, baby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Stanley! She runs to his arms and they embrace in a passionate kiss. But Tina suddenly pulls back and begins rapidly licking Stanley's ear... which is kinda weird. E.C.U. - STANLEY STANLEY Tina? Stanley suddenly realizes Milo is licking his ear... and he's just woken up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Milo, down. He pushes Milo away, tosses back the covers and rises out of bed. It's still the dead of night and Stanley is all in a huff from his dream. He spots Tina's clipping on his dresser mirror and rips it off, upset with himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Stupid, stupid. She'd never... Stanley wheels about and to his complete surprise sees...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through his bedroom window, propped up on the fourth story ledge. Its leering grin seems to beckon Stanley as we begin to hear the POUNDING beat of the Mask F.X. theme.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: stands transfixed, staring at the moonlit face. He can almost hear echos of faint whispered VOICES calling his name. A deadly siren song above the pounding drums.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... He backs away from the window. E.C.U. - THE MASK shimmers as the WHISPERS grow louder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: takes a last look at the crumpled picture of Tina in his hand and finally loses control. He bolts from the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley is a driven man as he makes his way out onto the narrow ledge. Milo tugs at his pajama leg, but Stanley kicks him away and climbs out over the ledge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stanley wavers precariously on the crumbling masonry, then catches his balance. His face is bathed in sweat as he gazes at the leering face. F.X. music THUNDERS in his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (faint echos) Stanley... Stanley. Stanley tries to steady himself, his eyes transfixed on his prize.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just... one... last... time. He lurches back out and makes his way one shaky step at a time towards the mask.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: watches from the apratment window, whimpering softly. C.U. - THE LEDGE Narrow masonry begins to crumble.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: carefully reaches down, his fingers just brushing the mask as he teeters out over nothingness. Night traffic whizzes by down below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: cracks away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he begins to fall, jamming the mask to his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The window suddenly EXPLODES inwards as the whirling Stanley/Mask tornado bursts into the room. Milo dives for cover. The tornado scorches the rug as it wheels around the room, then SCREECHES to a halt, revealing the Mask in his full glory. He strikes a grand entrance pose with his arms held high.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I gotta be me! I just gotta be me! He ZZZIPS into the bathroom
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mask sticks the picture of Tina on the bathroom mirror and blows her a kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a'la Big Bopper) Oooooh Bay-bee. I knoooooows what you likah! He sprouts a couple of extra arms as he madly brushes his teeth, sprays on cologne and bats himself with a powder puff all at once. He ZZZIPS into the bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mask stands before a full length mirror and checks himself out. With a magical "hands are quicker than the eye" move, he CHANGES wardrobe instantly... now posing in an effete fashion victim Don Johnson-style suit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The G.Q. look?... Naw. In a TWINKLING he's changed again: now in MTV Rapper-style over- sized jeans and backwards baseball cap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: s? (shakes his head) For buttonheads only. He changes again in a flash... This time he's naked except for his Calvin Klein underwear (his stomach muscles appear super-cut washboard-style).
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Marky Mark, eat your heart out. He changes one last time and appears in a wild banana yellow zoot suit complete with a snap brim fedora. That's the ticket!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) S-s-s-mokin! Now let's see... The Mask quickly searches his pockets. He pulls his pants pockets inside out and a moth flutters out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) What? Seems to be a minor cash flow problem here! I don't like to keep a lady waiting, but... (points a finger in the air) First things first! The Mask ZZZIPS out of frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The street is quiet and empty, except for a Dipsy Doodle Diaper delivery van parked across from the bank.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crowded with Dorian's men, it's been set up as a makeshift control room for the robbery. Dr. Freeze SLAPS a clip in his 9mm and looks down through the van's false bottom to Sweet Eddy, who is standing in an open manhole working on a bundle of underground wiring.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE What's the E.T.A.?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Another five minutes. Freeze synchronizes his watch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Counting down... now. Freeze presses a button on the side of a miniaturized headset he's wearing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE (CONT.) (into headset) Lookin' good here, my man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sits at his desk, speaking into a high tech walkie talkie. In the B.G. Dorian's wall-mounted video monitors display live shots of the club in full swing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice work, Freeze. You boy are on your own now. I've got to make sure I'm seen downstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE (V.O.) Do it, man. The Doctah is about to operate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freeze turns to his men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE Gentlemen... (cocks his gun) Let's do our duty and grab the booty. The burglars gather their gear when suddenly the bank alarm starts RINGING. Freeze looks down the hole to Sweet Eddy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . FREEZE (CONT.) What the hell you doin', fool?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing! I didn't do nothing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the others) C'mon! You keep that motor runnin'!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Freeze and company race across the street with guns drawn.
